description: A conceptual framework used to understand network interactions in seven layers: Physical, Data Link, Network, Transport, Session, Presentation, and Application.
keyPoints: Each layer serves the layer above and is served by the layer below.

description: A practical, four-layer networking model that maps to real-world protocols: Link, Internet, Transport, and Application layers.
keyPoints: Includes protocols like IP, TCP, UDP, HTTP, and FTP.

description: A technique used to divide an IP network into smaller, more efficient sub-networks or subnets.
keyPoints: Uses subnet masks and CIDR notation.

description: A logical subgroup within a physical network that isolates broadcast domains at the data link layer.
keyPoints: Segregates network traffic without additional hardware.
Improves security and reduces broadcast traffic.
Configured on managed switches and routers.

description: The process of selecting paths in a network along which to send data packets.
keyPoints: Uses routing tables and protocols like OSPF, EIGRP, BGP.
Routers forward packets based on destination IP addresses.
